vpnInterface.tooltip: You should be able to leave this field empty. This applet will try to detect this.

vpnName.tooltip:
This information is automatically changed when connecting to a VPN.
It therefore contains the name of the last VPN to which you connected.

connectAtStartup.description: Connect to VPN as this applet starts.
connectAtStartup.tooltip: Checking this allows this applet to try to connect to the last VPN at start-up.

reconnect.description: Try to reconnect to VPN when it shuts down incidentally.
reconnect.tooltip: Checking this allows this applet to try to reconnect to VPN when it shuts down incidentally.

respectUserRequest.description: Do not try to reconnect automatically if the VPN has been disconnected by the user.
respectUserRequest.tooltip: If, by this applet only, the user disconnects the VPN, then no automatic reconnection will be tried.

refreshInterval-spinner.tooltip: Time interval, in seconds, between two verifications of VPN link status. A low value increases security but causes more activity. Choose a value that is greater as your computer is slow.

displayType.tooltip: This feature offers the Classic (default) display with icon and text, and compact display (Icon Only).

useSoundAlert.description: Emit an audible alert when VPN shuts down.
useSoundAlert.tooltip: Checking this allows this applet to emit an audible alert when VPN shuts down.

useSoundAlertAtBeginning.description: Emit this audible alert when this Applet starts, if VPN is down.
useSoundAlertAtBeginning.tooltip: Check this if you want to emit this audible alert when this Applet starts, if VPN is down.

keybinding.description: Set the keybinding here to activate/deactivate the last used VPN.

manageClients.tooltip: This option allows this applet to manage the VPN-related applications you listed above.

clientsList.tooltip:
Name: What you want.
Command: The command to run the application, without its path.
Restart: Set to TRUE if you want to restart this application as soon as the VPN link becomes active again.
Shutdown: Set to TRUE if you want to close the application as soon as the VPN link is stopped.
VPN only: Set to TRUE if you want to quickly stop this application if it is started while the VPN is idle.

doLogActivity.description: Log the VPN status changes and the VPN-related Apps status changes
doLogActivity.tooltip:
This option allows this applet to log the VPN status changes and the VPN-related applications status changes.
You will can display the log file to make diagnostics.

logLifetime.tooltip: Lifetime of a record in the log file, in days.
